item.title: Fascinating Results from Leaders Eat Last Poll
item.description: This is the story of hard choices and how people resist making them. Last week’s poll asked you to watch a video by Simon Sinek before answering two, simple, two-part questions: which Republican candidate for President and Missouri Governor is most likely and least likely to eat last? I intended the poll to be hard. Not complicated, not long, but emotionally challenging. Why the Poll Was Emotionally Challenging For several weeks, I have built a case for the importance of leadership.

item.title: Poll: Which Candidate Qualities Matter Most?
item.description: Powered by Typeform Voting ends Saturday at midnight.

item.title: Analysis of Donald Trump Poll
item.description: Last week’s poll asked for your degree of support for Donald Trump’s candidacy. This poll received far less attention than the Missouri GOP Governor poll of the previous week, as only 60 people responded. On the plus side, there was no detectable cheating on the Trump poll. One Word: Polarization [caption id="attachment_16313” align="aligncenter” width="600”]Histogram of Trump Poll[/caption] Respondents had choices from 0 to 5 to indicate their degree of support for Trump, with 0 = No Support and 5 = Total Support.

item.title: Poll: What Do You Think About Service?
item.description: Last week, we posted a 5-part series on national service. This week, we’d like to see what you think. Be heard The poll closes Saturday, August 1 at Midnight. Please vote only once. Last Week’s Poll: Trump Here’s my analysis of last week’s poll on Donald Trump.

item.title: Did You Vote?
item.description: Voter turnout was down in every state from 2008. In many states, turnout was lower than 2004. [polldaddy poll=6672784] Thanks for responding.
